page.title: 03TRANSPORT IN PRIVETT
page.content: One regular bus service operates between Winchester and Petersfield along the A272, picking up passengers at the West Meon Hut, a walk of 2-3 miles for the Privett villagers. From the village one bus in each direction takes and returns school children and those whose business is in Alton. On Wednesdays the yellow Plus Bus takes shoppers to Petersfield market, making extra use of a school bus. For the scattered Privett families a car is a necessity. Most housewives drive to the shops,doctor, dentist and share the school run. Transport is an aspect of country-dwelling which brings most problems. Well-catered for during their school years, young people need to travel longer distances for employment. At l6 most youngsters use mopeds and they will learn to drive as soon as legally possible.
